C. an inclined plane
D. a wheel and axle

Daphnee is going to build a model of the solar system for her science project. She decides that a meter (m) will represent one astronomical unit (AU) in her model. Based on this scale, how far away from the Sun would she need to place Earth?
A. one meter
B. two meters
C. three meters
D. four meters

A lizard in a desert sits on a warm rock. Where does the heat energy in the rock come from?
A. the Sun
B. the lizard's skin
C. deep within Earth
D. the decay of plant materials

What is the major cause of ocean waves?
A. wind
B. Moon's gravity
C. salinity
D. Earth's rotation

What type of graph would be best for recording plant growth over a one-week period?
A. pie chart
B. line graph
C. scatterplot
D. histogram

A scientist compares ancient animal tracks to modern animal tracks. Which conclusion is the scientist most likely to reach?
A. Some ancient animals and some modern animals walk on four legs.
B. Most ancient animals and most modern animals hunt animals for food.
C. The same animals that lived long ago also live today.
D. All animals can walk.
examples.target: A. Some ancient animals and some modern animals walk on four legs.

examples.input:
A group of citizens want to have a statue built out of marble. They want to place it in a climate that has a slow rate of chemical weathering. In which type of climate would it be best to place the statue for the slowest rate of chemical weathering?
A. hot and dry
B. cold and dry
C. hot and humid
D. cold and humid

According to scientists, donkeys and horses share a common ancestor. Which evidence shows that the two organisms are related?
A. Both are tall.
B. Both run fast.
C. They have the same diet.
D. They have the same bones in their limbs.
examples.target: D. They have the same bones in their limbs.

examples.input:
Which relationship is mutualistic?
A. an insect that lives and feeds on the body of an alligator
B. an ant that lives on a plant and defends the plant from other insects
C. a bird that migrates to follow the movements of the butterflies that it eats
D. a deer that eats one kind of plant, which allows another kind of plant to grow in its place
examples.target: B. an ant that lives on a plant and defends the plant from other insects

examples.input:
In humans, B is the allele for brown eyes and b is the allele for blue eyes. Two brothers both have brown eyes, but one of them has both the B and b alleles while the other only has B alleles. Which statement is true about the brothers?
A. They have the same genotype and phenotype.
B. They have different phenotypes and genotypes.
C. They have the same phenotype but different genotypes.
D. They have the same genotype but different phenotypes.
examples.target: C. They have the same phenotype but different genotypes.

examples.input:
Which of the following is broken down in the body to release energy?
A. sugar.
B. water.
C. salt.
D. oxygen.

Which property is thought to characterize objects in the Oort Cloud?
A. They are composed mostly of iron.
B. They are composed mostly of ice.
C. They regularly revolve near the Sun.
D. They regularly replenish water on Earth.
examples.target: B. They are composed mostly of ice.

examples.input:
Sound travels as a
A. wave without a medium.
B. series of compressions only.
C. pattern of up and down vibrations.
D. pattern of compressions and rarefactions.
examples.target: D. pattern of compressions and rarefactions.

examples.input:
Astronomers have been studying objects that are very bright and appear to be very far away. They have since concluded that these objects are distant galaxies with giant black holes at their center known as
A. pulsars.
B. quasars.
C. supernovas.
D. binary stars.

Which unit of measurement should be used to describe the  mass of an apple?
A. gram
B. liter
C. minute
D. meter

Scientists have created trains that use magnets to make the trains float above the tracks as they travel. These trains float because
1. the track is waxed
2. the like poles repel
3. the train has a low density
4. a chemical change occurs

One role of a producer in a food chain is to provide
A. water for plants
B. sunlight for plants
C. nutrients for animals
D. shelter for animals

Tectonic motion caused tension between plates in Earth's crust. A sudden release of this energy occurred. Based on this information, which event happened?
A. subsidence
B. earthquake
C. volcanic eruption
D. meteoroid impact

The teacher heats a pot of water. Once the water reaches 100°C, which point has the water reached?
A. boiling
B. melting
C. freezing
D. evaporating

What is the major cause of seasonal changes?
A. tilt of the Earth's axis
B. Earth changing its distance from the Sun
C. changing patterns in wind and ocean currents
D. cycles in the amount of energy released by the Sun
examples.target: A. tilt of the Earth's axis

examples.input:
In 1989, the unusually low snowpack in portions of the Sierra Nevada Mountains led to a widespread emergence of Edith's checkerspot butterflies in April. In these regions, flowers do not appear until May. What was the most likely result of the early emergence of these butterflies?
A. Most butterflies did not survive.
B. Most butterflies reproduced earlier.
C. Most butterflies switched to other food sources.
D. Most butterflies adapted to the new environment.
examples.target: A. Most butterflies did not survive.

examples.input:
Which scientist developed the mathematical models used to describe the changes in the motion of objects as well as the forces that cause the change in motion?
A. Dalton
B. Newton
C. Aristotle
D. Ptolemy

Which natural event would take the longest time to happen?
A. a cloud forming
B. a mountain forming
C. a pond evaporating
D. a river flooding its banks
examples.target: D. a river flooding its banks

examples.input:
Which property of a substance indicates whether the substance is a liquid or a solid at room temperature?
1. melting point
2. electrical conductivity
3. flexibility
4. solubility

Which organelle converts glucose to energy for cellular work?
A. nucleus
B. mitochondrion
C. vacuole
D. chloroplast

The length of a year is determined by the amount of time it takes
A. the Moon to revolve around Earth.
B. Earth to revolve around the Sun.
C. Earth to rotate on its axis.
D. the Sun to rotate on its axis.
examples.target: B. Earth to revolve around the Sun.

examples.input:
A tick attaches to a deer and consumes blood, harming the deer. This is an example of which type of relationship?
A. predator-prey
B. mutualism
C. parasite-host
D. commensalism

Cactus plants grow best in environments (habitats) that are
A. hot and dry.
B. hot and wet.
C. cold and dry.
D. cold and wet.

Where does water in a lake get most of its energy to evaporate?
A. The sun heating the lake
B. Green plants living in the lake
C. Streams entering the lake
D. Cold springs under the lake
examples.target: A. The sun heating the lake

examples.input:
A scientist trying to identify an unknown liquid may heat the liquid. Which would be the best reason for the scientist to heat the liquid?
A. to observe a color change
B. to get rid of most impurities
C. to identify the boiling point
D. to collect gases for additional study
examples.target: C. to identify the boiling point

examples.input:
During a laboratory investigation, a student cracks a clean, empty Erlenmeyer flask. It does not break, but it can no longer be used. Where should the flask be placed?
A. trash can
B. biohazard bag
C. broken glass bin
D. hazardous waste bin

A light bulb transforms electrical energy into light energy. A light bulb also transforms electrical energy into
A. heat energy
B. potential energy
C. magnetic energy
D. mechanical energy

Jonas needs to split a log. He has a sledge hammer. What other tool should he also use to split the log?
A. a lever
B. a pulley
C. a wedge
D. a fulcrum

Hurricanes are driven by the energy they get from ocean water. Which property of water allows it to retain the energy needed to power a hurricane?
A. low vapor pressure
B. high specific heat
C. high surface tension
D. low freezing point

Which organisms contribute most to the decomposition of dead organisms?
A. snakes
B. viruses
C. insects
D. bacteria

What is one difference between birds and reptiles?
A. Birds lay eggs and reptiles do not.
B. Reptiles are meat-eaters and birds are not.
C. Birds breathe oxygen and reptiles do not.
D. Reptiles are cold-blooded and birds are not.
examples.target: D. Reptiles are cold-blooded and birds are not.

examples.input:
The ounce, the pound, and the ton are units of
A. time.
B. weight.
C. length.
D. distance.

A student uses clay to construct a model of Earth. Which layer of the model should be the thinnest layer?
A. the layer representing the mantle
B. the layer representing the outer core
C. the layer representing the inner core
D. the layer representing the crust
examples.target: D. the layer representing the crust

examples.input:
A scientist observes that both birds and snakes in the same ecosystem depend on the same mouse species as a food source. The relationship between the birds and the snakes is an example of
A. predation.
B. mutualism.
C. competition.
D. commensalism.

Animals get energy from the food they eat. What is the original source of this energy?
A. the soil
B. the water cycle
C. the Sun
D. fertilizers

Many human activities, such as driving a car, cause the release of air pollutants. Which substance is a common air pollutant when driving a car?
A. carbon monoxide
B. chlorine
C. nitrogen
D. iron oxide

Which environment would most likely have rich, fertile soil?
A. a desert plain
B. a coastal beach
C. a mountain peak
D. a flood plain

In 1785, James Hutton, stated that evidence of past occurrences can be used to explain events which happen today. Which could most likely be used to explain an event in the geologic past?
A. sunspots
B. earthquakes
C. wave patterns
D. cloud formations

The elements sulfur (S) and oxygen combine to form a substance called sulfur dioxide (SO2). Sulfur dioxide is also formed when coal and oil are burned. Sulfur dioxide can best be described as
A. a metal
B. an atom
C. a compound
D. a nonreactive gas

If a pond is polluted by soap that has phosphate, this pollutant will cause the algae to quickly reproduce. Which will most likely increase in the pond if this happens to the algae?
A. sulfur
B. oxygen
C. nitrogen
D. carbon dioxide

In order to carry out the functions of life, organisms must
A. have more than one type of cell.
B. be exposed to sunlight.
C. have at least one cell.
D. be able to move.
examples.target: C. have at least one cell.

examples.input:
A roller coaster is climbing up the highest hill on its track. At which point will the front car of the coaster most likely have its greatest potential energy?
A. at the bottom of the highest hill
B. at the top of the highest hill
C. at the start of the track
D. at the end of the track
examples.target: B. at the top of the highest hill

examples.input:
What is the mass of an asteroid with a speed of 200 m/s and a momentum of 2,000 kg x m/s?
A. 10 kg
B. 1,800 kg
C. 2,200 kg
D. 400,000 kg

Some scientists study images of very distant celestial bodies. Where is the best location for the types of telescopes that can provide the scientists with the clearest images.
A. at sea level
B. in outer space
C. on mountain tops
D. at higher latitudes

How do people get energy and nutrients?
A. breathing clean air
B. exercising and playing
C. getting plenty of rest
D. eating healthy food

Which action is a learned characteristic of a newborn horse?
A. nursing
B. walking
C. sleeping
D. breathing

An earthquake is caused by sudden shifts in which of the following layers of Earth?
A. outer core
B. crust
C. inner core
D. mesosphere

A black bear's diet includes nuts, berries, honey, insects, and fish. Black bears are
A. decomposers.
B. herbivores.
C. omnivores.
D. prey.

The news often talks about how global warming could change environmental conditions on Earth. Which best explains why global warming is such a concern?
A. Glaciers will advance.
B. The sea level will rise.
C. Earthquake activity will increase.
D. The overall temperature will decrease.
examples.target: B. The sea level will rise.

examples.input:
Animal cells perform functions using energy that is derived from glucose (C6H12O6). Which molecule is required for animal cells to obtain the most energy possible from a molecule of glucose?
A. water
B. oxygen
C. lactic acid
D. carbon dioxide

Stomata are tiny pores located on the leaves of plants. These pores permit the exchange of gases between air in the environment and plant cells located inside the leaf. Which tissue performs a similar function in vertebrates?
A. The cornea in the eye
B. The alveoli in the lungs
C. The chambers in the heart
D. The salivary glands in the mouth
examples.target: B. The alveoli in the lungs

examples.input:
When crossing parents with genotypes Rr and rr, what will be the percentages of the genotypes of the offspring?
A. 75% Rr, 25% rr
B. 50% Rr, 50% rr
C. 100% Rr
D. 100% rr

Which information will best help scientists determine if an object is a comet, an asteroid, or a meteoroid?
A. the object's diameter
B. the object's composition
C. the shape of the object's orbit
D. the speed at which the object travels

In an ocean ecosystem, dead organisms such as fish and plankton sink to the bottom of the ocean. Which organisms break down and recycle the dead organisms?
A. algae
B. bacteria
C. mollusks
D. sponges

Which is the best description of the brightness of the Sun?
A. It is less bright than planets.
B. It is brighter than other stars.
C. It is of average brightness compared to planets.
D. It is of average brightness compared to other stars.
examples.target: D. It is of average brightness compared to other stars.

examples.input:
Which process passes genetic information from plants to their offspring?
A. germination
B. pollination
C. photosynthesis
D. adaptation

What must happen in order for scientific data to be verified through repetition?
A. Accurate records must be kept.
B. Modern technology must be used.
C. Investigations must be conducted by trained scientists.
D. Observations must be made by more than one scientist.
examples.target: A. Accurate records must be kept.

examples.input:
Which particle type can be identified as being from a specific element?
A. electron
B. atom
C. neutron
D. proton

Which of the following is a chemical property of a substance?
A. mass of 372 g
B. reacts with HCl
C. density of 37 g/cm^3
D. white powder with silver specks

Which structure is found in a plant cell but not in an animal cell?
1. cell wall
2. cell membrane
3. cytoplasm
4. nucleus

Which of these best describes a fossil?
A. a geometric pattern formed by a mineral
B. a solid element or compound from Earth's crust
C. remains of an extinct organism found in a rock layer
D. bits of weathered rocks and pieces of dead organisms
examples.target: C. remains of an extinct organism found in a rock layer

examples.input:
A student is conducting an investigation using chemicals. Other than goggles and gloves, what else should the student use in order to conduct this investigation safely?
A. lab coat
B. Petri dish
C. Bunsen burner
D. loose-fitting clothing

The boiling point of nitrogen is -196°C. What states of matter are involved when nitrogen boils?
A. solid to gas
B. liquid to gas
C. liquid to solid
D. gas to liquid

The Hubble Space Telescope is a telescope that NASA launched into space in 1990. Scientists most likely prefer to use the Hubble Space Telescope instead of a land-based telescope because it provides better accuracy at
A. predicting solar eclipses.
B. investigating faraway galaxies.
C. investigating the size of Venus.
D. predicting the phases of the Moon.

Which of the following statements best describes a complex machine?
A. It is designed to move with a motor.
B. It is constructed from machine-made parts.
C. It is made of more than one simple machine.
D. It is built from more than one type of material.
examples.target: C. It is made of more than one simple machine.

examples.input:
A drug company developed a pill to reduce cases of stomach virus. To test the medication, half of the participants got the pill with the new medicine and half got a sugar pill. Which term best identifies the participants who got a sugar pill?
A. control
B. experimental
C. dependent variable
D. independent variable

Which information does a student need to differentiate between the speed and the velocity of a vehicle in motion?
A. the rate of the motion
B. the direction of the motion
C. the change in the amount of motion
D. the amount of distance traveled during motion
examples.target: B. the direction of the motion

examples.input:
When do mutations help make an ecosystem more sustainable?
A. when mutations decrease the number of individuals in an ecosystem
B. when mutations increase the number of individuals in an ecosystem
C. when mutations decrease the number of species in an ecosystem
D. when mutations increase the number of species in an ecosystem
examples.target: D. when mutations increase the number of species in an ecosystem

examples.input:
Which scientist would be most likely to study the changes in animal populations in nature?
A. Botanist
B. Engineer
C. Ecologist
D. Veterinarian

Humans use both renewable and nonrenewable resources. Which human activity uses a nonrenewable resource?
A. building houses with wood
B. using natural gas to heat homes
C. using solar energy to power lights
D. producing electricity from flowing water
examples.target: B. using natural gas to heat homes

examples.input:
Which best describes the motion of molecules in the gaseous state?
A. They vibrate quickly in place.
B. They spread apart to fill their container.
C. They move at the same speed as in a liquid.
D. They move slowly over one another.
examples.target: B. They spread apart to fill their container.

examples.input:
What is the downward movement of water through pores and other spaces in soil due to the force of gravity?
A. percolation
B. evaporation
C. precipitation
D. condensation

On Mount Everest the temperature decreases as the altitude increases. The summit of this mountain is in which atmospheric layer?
A. mesosphere
B. stratosphere
C. thermosphere
D. troposphere

Which energy source is considered nonrenewable?
1. moving water
2. fossil fuel
3. wind
4. biomass

A renewable energy source is a source that will not run out. Which is an example of the use of such a source?
A. A coal furnace heating a house
B. a windmill pumping water on a farm
C. a kerosene lamp lighting a room
D. a diesel truck traveling along a road
examples.target: B. a windmill pumping water on a farm

examples.input:
Which statement best describes why the Moon is visible from Earth?
A. The Moon reflects light from other planets.
B. The Moon reflects light from the Sun.
C. Light is produced by the Moon.
D. Light from Earth illuminates the Moon.
examples.target: B. The Moon reflects light from the Sun.

examples.input:
Which statement best explains the reason that electrical wires are made of copper?
A. Copper is strong.
B. Copper is flexible.
C. Copper is a conductor.
D. Copper is an insulator.

Which of these is a natural resource of Virginia?
A. A dam
B. A glacier
C. A river
D. A power plant

Insulin is a chemical that is released by the endocrine system to increase the absorption of glucose by the body's cells. After which activity would insulin levels in a healthy body increase?
A. drinking water
B. taking a nap
C. swimming
D. eating

An engineer was given an assignment to build a model rocket. The main requirement was that it had to build it out of a metal that could release the energy that built up when reentering the atmosphere of Earth. What property should the engineer concentrate on the most when designing the rocket?
A. density
B. ductility
C. specific heat
D. boiling point

Which color of light is produced when all of the colors of visible light in the electromagnetic spectrum are combined?
A. gray
B. white
C. black
D. brown

A company is making prototypes for a new computer system. Which of the following statements best describes an advantage of making several different prototypes?
A. They can be tested at the same time.
B. They can be produced in large numbers.
C. They will be bought by many different users.
D. They will be sold for more than they cost to build.
examples.target: A. They can be tested at the same time.

examples.input:
What is the function of the nucleus in a cell?
A. provides energy
B. provides nutrients
C. controls activity
D. controls movement

A tree is a renewable resource because it can be
A. burned in a fire.
B. made into lumber.
C. eaten by some organisms.
D. replaced with a newly planted tree.
examples.target: D. replaced with a newly planted tree.

examples.input:
How does the presence of organic matter contribute to good soil?
A. It adds nutrients to the soil.
B. It helps the soil to dry out.
C. It keeps the soil cool.
D. It destroys bacteria in the soil.
examples.target: A. It adds nutrients to the soil.

examples.input:
A wild turkey's forest community includes
A. insects
B. rainfall
C. soil
D. wind

Which of the following travels from neuron to neuron as information is transmitted?
A. electrochemical impulses
B. RNA strands
C. transport vesicles high in ATP
D. mechanical forces

During which process do cells use oxygen to release stored energy?
1. photosynthesis
2. respiration
3. circulation
4. digestion

Which of the following has the ability to change the state of matter?
A. heat
B. wind
C. light
D. sound

Many things can contribute to the development of a theory. A student made a list of some things that might help scientists develop a theory. Observations Calculations Conversations Publications From the student's list, which must be used in the development of every theory?
A. Observations
B. Conversations
C. Publications and calculations
D. Calculations and conversations

Ben has a snack with a combination of raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts. As he eats the snack, Ben picks out all of the raisins. Which best describes the snack Ben is eating?
A. a compound
B. an element
C. a solution
D. a mixture

Capillary walls are only one layer of cells thick. Passage of oxygen into and out of the capillaries is controlled most by which process?
A. collection of waste material
B. breakdown of materials
C. diffusion of material
D. storage of materials

The average car uses about 25% of the available energy in each gallon of gasoline. The energy not used to run the car is released as heat and sound. Which statement best describes this occurrence?
A. Energy conversion reduces efficiency.
B. Energy is destroyed at high temperatures.
C. Energy loss increases the order in a system.
D. Energy levels increase as conversions take place.

How long does it take light from the nearest star other than the Sun to reach Earth?
A. Less than 1 second
B. About 1 hour
C. About 1 month
D. About 4 years

Spider webs help spiders
A. avoid predators.
B. capture food.
C. stay dry.
D. keep warm.

Pouring water over a sloping tray of soil demonstrates how
A. soil can be washed away.
B. soil creation may take years.
C. river sediment forms a delta.
D. planting grass protects the soil.
examples.target: A. soil can be washed away.

examples.input:
Which layer of Earth is divided into plates?
A. Mantle
B. Crust
C. Inner core
D. Outer core

The breakdown of ozone into oxygen results from the electromagnetic absorption spectrum of ozone. This production of oxygen in the ozone layer is caused by exposing ozone to a strong source of which type of electromagnetic radiation?
A. radio waves
B. microwaves
C. infrared light
D. ultraviolet light

Which best describes what keeps the Moon orbiting around Earth?
A. speed
B. gravity
C. weight
D. friction

The hypothesis of an expanding universe required which type of validation before being accepted as a significant part of scientific theory?
A. a controlled single-variable laboratory test
B. support through evidence from numerous observations
C. proposal of alternative explanations with predictive value
D. a full-scale replication of each event in the proper sequence
examples.target: B. support through evidence from numerous observations

examples.input:
In which type of rock is the fossil imprint of a fern leaf most likely to be found?
1. igneous
2. metamorphic
3. sedimentary
4. volcanic

At certain times of the year, meteor showers can be observed from Earth. Why are these objects from space usually harmless?
A. They are always microscopic.
B. They are closer to the sun than to Earth.
C. They are made of soft, spongy materials.
D. They burn up high in Earth's atmosphere
examples.target: D. They burn up high in Earth's atmosphere

examples.input:
Which group of animals contains ONLY reptiles?
A. lizard, frog, snake
B. turtle, lizard, crocodile
C. octopus, snail, turtle
D. crab, earthworm, snake

Why is the particular sequence of bases in a segment of DNA important to cells?
A. Some base sequences code for protein production.
B. Some base sequences cause the release of lipids from the nucleus.
C. Some base sequences contain the order of sugars in polysaccharides.
D. Some base sequences produce electrical signals sent to the cytoplasm.
examples.target: A. Some base sequences code for protein production.

examples.input:
A meteorologist announces that the barometer reading is dropping. What does a barometer measure?
A. wind speed
B. air pressure
C. air temperature
D. ground temperature

A cricket population includes approximately the same number of black and light-brown crickets. Black crickets are easier for birds to locate and eat. Over time, the population begins to consist of only light-brown crickets. The change in the color of the cricket population is a result of
A. limited resources.
B. natural selection.
C. geographic isolation.
D. climate change.

When nearly vertical rays of solar energy strike a region of the Earth, that area has warm temperatures. What region of the Earth gets nearly vertical rays of solar energy year around?
A. Equator
B. Australia
C. United States
D. North and South Poles

Scientists from around the world would most likely meet at a conference held in Paris, France, to
A. learn how to speak the same language.
B. work together on scientific research.
C. teach students the importance of education.
D. show other scientists the scientific method.
examples.target: B. work together on scientific research.

examples.input:
Ferns belong to any one of about 12,000 species of plants grouped in their own division within the plant kingdom. Ferns are vascular, seedless, flowerless, and reproduce by spores. To which plant group do ferns belong?
A. Bryophyta
B. Gymnosperm
C. Angiosperm
D. Pteridophyta

A student ties a string around a weight and swings the weight in a circle around her body. If the student represents the Sun and the weight represents Earth, what does the string represent?
A. gravity
B. radiation
C. electricity
D. magnetism

Scientists have studied the specific stages in the life cycle of stars. In which stage do stars spend most of their lifetime?
A. red giant
B. black dwarf
C. white dwarf
D. main sequence

How does the energy in each trophic level of an energy pyramid compare to the energy in the preceding level?
A. It has about 5% of the energy from the level below it.
B. It has about 10% of the energy from the level below it.
C. It has about 15% of the energy from the level below it.
D. It has about 20% of the energy from the level below it.
examples.target: B. It has about 10% of the energy from the level below it.

examples.input:
The texture of soil depends primarily on the
A. mass of the soil.
B. water in the soil.
C. composition of the soil.
D. vegetation growing in the soil.

As children grow, their body height usually
A. decreases
B. increases
C. remains the same

Which is a force that keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun?
A. inertia
B. gravity
C. magnetism
D. solar energy

What is the role of the kidneys in the excretory system?
A. to digest food
B. to remove toxins
C. to produce bile
D. to oxygenate blood

Which number is closest to the estimated number of stars in the Milky Way galaxy?
A. 200 thousand
B. 200 million
C. 200 billion
D. 200 trillion

Which statement best describes how a mountain range changes over time from wind and water erosion?
A. The mountain range will become faulted.
B. The mountain range will be lifted up.
C. The mountain range will form craters.
D. The mountain range will become rounded.
examples.target: D. The mountain range will become rounded.

examples.input:
In a cell, a newly synthesized protein requires modification by the addition of a carbohydrate. Which structure will transport the protein from the site of synthesis to the site of modification?
A. a ribosome
B. the endoplasmic reticulum
C. the Golgi apparatus
D. a vacuole

Students notice that in the fall leaves of sugar maple trees turn red, but the leaves of black oak trees turn brown. The students are making
A. an observation
B. a conclusion
C. a prediction
D. an inference

What instrument should be used to monitor atmospheric pressure changes as a weather system approaches?
A. psychrometer
B. thermometer
C. anemometer
D. barometer

Which of the following is responsible for determining the traits of an organism?
A. number of phosphates
B. amount of thymine
C. sequence of nucleotides
D. type of bond between bases

In which organism can cell walls be found?
A. moth
B. grass
C. snake
D. hawk

Isaac Newton is best known for his study of
A. motion.
B. weather.
C. body systems.
D. the history of Earth.

Some objects are attracted by magnets. Which object is attracted by a magnet?
A. an iron nail
B. an ice cube
C. a plastic knife
D. a wooden ruler

Which action represents the use of technology to solve a problem?

examples.input:
When a guitar string is strummed, it produces sound by making

B. electricity.

D. a ship floating on the ocean

examples.input:

A scientist was observing a unicellular organism over a period of time. He noticed that vacuoles kept moving to the same place in the plasma membrane to empty their contents outside the cell. Which organism was he observing?
A. amoeba
B. euglena
C. paramecium
D. volvox

Which form of precipitation is most likely to cause damage when hitting the roof of a car?

B. rain
C. sleet
D. snow

B. compass
C. microscope

The density of 200 mL of water was determined, and then 20 grams of sugar was dissolved in the water. The student determined the density of the sugar-water solution and recorded the collected data in a table. The sugar in this investigation is

B. the tilted axis of Earth

D. the elliptical shape of the orbit of Earth
examples.target: B. the tilted axis of Earth

examples.input:

B. line graph

B. ClNO_{3}

D. AgCl

Which invention has done the most to help predict weather and warn people of approaching storms?

During the Siberian summer, reindeer graze on young roots, fungi, grass, and other vegetation. In the cold winter months, they migrate south and rely on available, but less nutritious food, such as lichen. D. move to other areas to compete for resources.
examples.target: D. move to other areas to compete for resources.

examples.input:
Sir Isaac Newton stated that every object in the universe attracts matter. The attraction depends on the mass of an object and the distance between the objects. What type of force did Newton describe?

B. generalized force

What season is the Northern Hemisphere experiencing when it is tilted away from the Sun?

B. summer

D. winter

Heat is applied to a beaker of water, raising the water temperature a few degrees. What happens to the water molecules after heat is applied?

D. The molecules come together and move more quickly.
examples.target: B. The molecules spread apart and move more quickly.

examples.input:

B. a volcano

B. liver
C. lungs
D. pancreas

A positively-charged hydrogen ion has a much smaller radius than a neutral hydrogen atom. Which best explains this difference?

examples.target: B. Electrons are located far from the nuclei of their atoms.

examples.input:

examples.input:

examples.target: D. density of the aluminum cube

examples.input:

C. remain pliable after hardening.
D. be molded into almost any shape.
examples.target: D. be molded into almost any shape.

examples.input:

examples.input:

examples.input:

examples.input:
If Earth revolved at a faster rate, what would most likely occur?

The distance from Earth to the Sun is one astronomical unit. Which unit best describes how many astronomical units it is from Earth to the far end of the Milky Way Galaxy?

B. thousands
C. millions
D. billions

Which is most likely to cause an organism to become endangered or extinct?
A. habitat loss
B. behavioral changes
C. increased reproduction rate
D. altered migration patterns

What are the characteristics of maritime polar air masses?

B. warm and dry
C. cool and humid
D. warm and humid

In an ecosystem, which list of organisms is in the correct order from producer to top-level consumer?

examples.target: C. grass, field mouse, snake, hawk

examples.input:

B. All foods taste good.

B. vinegar

D. metamorphic rocks.

examples.input:

B. decomposers

D. producers

D. compound

B. soil

D. water

B. gravitation

examples.input:

examples.input:
Which of the following results when hydrogen and chlorine chemically bond to form hydrogen chloride?

B. a solution

Scientists are able to conclude that a forested ecosystem existed in Antarctica millions of years ago by studying

examples.input:
In order for plants to grow, the cells require nutrients in the form of minerals. The minerals come from
A. soil.
B. air.
C. water.

HIV makes the body vulnerable to secondary infections by targeting

C. topographic map
D. nautical chart

A student put a metal pot on the stove to boil some water. The metal transferred heat to the water through
A. radiation.
B. insulation.
C. convection.
D. conduction.

Which feature is a kitten most likely to inherit from its parents?
A. diet
B. color
C. health
D. independence

Proteins are compounds formed in the cells of plants and animals. Which element is included in every protein molecule?
A. calcium
B. carbon
C. fluorine
D. sodium

A rocket is traveling toward space. What force must the rocket act against as it moves away from Earth?
A. inertia
B. gravity
C. magnetism
D. momentum

A group of workers needs to move a piano from the second floor of a building. The piano is too wide to fit through the door, so they will lower the piano to the ground through a window. Which tool would be best to help the workers lower the piano from the window?
A. wheel and axle
B. inclined plane
C. pulley
D. wedge

Why is a spacesuit inflated like a balloon?
A. to simulate the air pressure of Earth
B. to help astronauts float in outer space
C. to protect astronauts from solar radiation
D. to provide an oxygen supply for breathing
examples.target: A. to simulate the air pressure of Earth

examples.input:
Which term best describes the process responsible for cave formation that results from rock being dissolved by groundwater?
A. chemical weathering
B. glacial movement
C. sedimentation
D. abrasion

What happens to colored sugar when it is added to water?
A. The sugar reacts and colors the water.
B. The sugar becomes white and the water changes color.
C. The sugar evaporates and the water changes color.
D. The sugar dissolves and colors the water.
examples.target: D. The sugar dissolves and colors the water.

examples.input:
Which statement about plant and animals cells is true?
A. Both have a cell wall to give them support.
B. Both have a large vacuole to store water.
C. Both use mitochondria to produce energy.
D. Both use chloroplasts to store energy.
examples.target: C. Both use mitochondria to produce energy.

examples.input:
Farm fertilizers are often carried by runoff into the Mississippi River and down to the Gulf of Mexico, resulting in algae blooms. Which of these results from the decomposition of the algae blooms?
A. an abundance of dissolved oxygen
B. dead zones where there are no fish
C. a reduction in atmospheric carbon dioxide
D. food webs with rapidly growing populations
examples.target: B. dead zones where there are no fish

examples.input:
Jennifer is jumping rope. Which type of characteristic is she most likely demonstrating?
A. learned
B. recessive
C. inherited
D. instinctive

A teacher breaks a bar of pure copper into two different sized pieces. Which is the most likely difference between the two pieces?
A. mass
B. texture
C. boiling point
D. melting point

Blood is a fluid made up of several different parts. What level of structural organization best describes blood?
A. a cell
B. a tissue
C. an organ
D. a system

Scientists found large areas of fossilized wood in a desert in Arizona. The fossilized wood is evidence of the ancient environment. Based on the evidence, what was the ancient environment in this area?
A. forest
B. desert
C. glacier
D. grasslands

Ruben is using a compass to find out which direction the wind is blowing. Which of the following would be best for him to observe to help him find the direction of the wind?
A. a flag on a pole
B. the temperature on a thermometer
C. birds flying above the trees
D. the shadow of a building
examples.target: A. a flag on a pole

examples.input:
A farmer predicts a new sprinkler will keep water from being wasted. What term best describes this prediction?
A. experiment
B. hypothesis
C. observation
D. variable

Tides on Earth are mostly caused by the gravitational pull of
A. the Sun.
B. stars.
C. the Moon.
D. asteroids.

When rain falls on the land, some of it is absorbed by surface sediment. How porous the surface sediments are controls how much water is absorbed. Which of the following will most likely result in an area where surface sediment is NOT porous?
A. flooding
B. droughts
C. tornadoes
D. spring formation

Which of the following parts of a car belongs to its control system?
A. fuel tank
B. hydraulic jack
C. steering wheel
D. windshield wipers

Which substance can be used to conduct electricity in a circuit?
A. metal
B. wood
C. rubber
D. plastic

Which unit is used to express the amount of energy in food?
1. Calorie
2. degree Celsius
3. milliliter
4. gram

A student measured how quickly a car rolled down a hill. Which tool should the student have used to measure how quickly the car rolled down the hill?
A. a hand lens
B. a stopwatch
C. a thermometer
D. a centimeter ruler

Water at 20 degrees Celsius is placed on a stove. As the water is heated, thermal energy is absorbed by the water. If the water is heated to a maximum temperature of 80 degrees Celsius, what happens as a result of the increased temperature?
A. The potential energy increases.
B. The evaporation decreases.
C. The disorder decreases.
D. The entropy increases.

The electromagnetic spectrum is described as a
A. series of colors of the rainbow.
B. list of radioactive elements.
C. band of frequencies of light waves.
D. range of conductivity of metals.
examples.target: C. band of frequencies of light waves.

examples.input:
Which of the following is most important in producing the seasons on Earth?
A. Earth's gravitational attraction to the Sun
B. the Moon's revolution around Earth
C. the distance of Earth from the Sun
D. the tilt of Earth's axis as it revolves around the Sun
examples.target: D. the tilt of Earth's axis as it revolves around the Sun

examples.input:
Which of the following is designed to convert energy into mechanical work?
A. Electric fan
B. Kerosene heater
C. Flashlight
D. Baking oven

A student hears the sound of a bell. Which of the following carries the sound of the bell to the student?
A. electrical currents
B. magnetic signals
C. radio waves
D. vibrating air

The first stage of soil formation is the weathering of rock into fine particles. To make a good soil for growing plants, which would be best to add to the rock particles?
A. minerals
B. sand
C. organic matter
D. silt

Which best describes a scientific theory?
A. It is still being tested.
B. It is true, once written.
C. It is different for each continent.
D. It is determined in a court of law.
examples.target: A. It is still being tested.

examples.input:
Scientists are studying the factors that influence the climate of a region. In attempts to gather accurate data, the scientists should use data that includes the
A. number of earthquakes that occur each year.
B. types of organisms in the environment.
C. number of people living in the area.
D. type of weather that has occurred.
examples.target: D. type of weather that has occurred.

examples.input:
Why do two surfaces get warm when they are rubbed together?
A. The surfaces absorb energy from the air.
B. Friction changes energy of motion to heat energy.
C. Moving objects produce heat energy.
D. Energy is transferred between the two surfaces.
examples.target: B. Friction changes energy of motion to heat energy.

examples.input:
Two high tides and two low tides occur on Earth every
A. day.
B. hour.
C. week.
D. month.

A book placed on a table is observed to remain stationary. Which statement about the observation would be considered a fact rather than an opinion?
A. The book is not very heavy.
B. The table pushes up on the book.
C. The book probably has a sticky cover.
D. The table is composed of a stronger material than the book.
examples.target: B. The table pushes up on the book.

examples.input:
Having students wash their hands frequently with soap and water will limit the spread of infectious disease by
A. protecting harmless bacterial cells.
B. changing viral and bacterial nucleic acids.
C. releasing mutated cells from pores.
D. removing viruses and bacteria from the skin.
examples.target: D. removing viruses and bacteria from the skin.

examples.input:
Which object helps people understand what makes up white light?
A. Barometer
B. Prism
C. Microscope
D. Thermometer

Water vapor sometimes condenses into stratus clouds that are in contact with the ground. What forms as a result of this process?
A. ozone
B. methane
C. fog
D. smoke

One of the main causes of acid rain is
A. Waste from nuclear power plants
B. Spills from chemical manufacturing plants
C. Gases from burning fossil fuels
D. Gases from aerosol spray cans
examples.target: C. Gases from burning fossil fuels

examples.input:
Which of these activities makes the MOST air pollution?
A. Storing trash bags
B. Reusing trash bags
C. Burning trash bags
D. Recycling trash bags

The Hardy-Weinberg law is only valid when
A. the population is small.
B. migration into the population is occurring.
C. immigration into the population is occurring.
D. the population is large.

Deposition of sediment during floods makes the land near some rivers
A. acidic.
B. fertile.
C. hilly.
D. unstable.

Old, worn-out rubber tires are called scrap tires. Which way of disposing of scrap tires is best for the environment?
A. burning the tires
B. dumping the tires in a lake
C. burying the tires in a landfill
D. taking the tires to a recycling center
examples.target: D. taking the tires to a recycling center

examples.input:
Which material is the best conductor of heat at room temperature?
A. air
B. water
C. sulfur
D. copper

A student drops a white tablet into a glass of water, producing carbon dioxide gas. This is a demonstration of
A. a change of state.
B. a chemical reaction.
C. the creation of matter.
D. the movement of electricity.

Which of these is a structure that is present in all organisms?
A. a tissue
B. a cell
C. a stomach
D. a brain

Which set of conditions will produce an electric current in a closed loop of wire?
A. a magnet touching the loop of wire
B. a magnet at rest inside the loop of wire
C. a magnet at rest outside the loop of wire
D. a magnet passing through the loop of wire
examples.target: D. a magnet passing through the loop of wire

examples.input:
Extensive folding of sedimentary rock layers on Earth provides indirect evidence of certain processes occurring throughout Earth's history. Which of these is most likely one of these processes?
A. convective heat loss from Earth's mantle
B. slowing of the rotation of Earth's core
C. increase in the density of Earth's atmosphere
D. slow increase in the distance of Earth's orbit
examples.target: A. convective heat loss from Earth's mantle

examples.input:
An ice cube melts on a hot summer day because the energy of the particles
A. decreases over a period of time and is lost.
B. increases and the particles move apart.
C. causes the particles to move closer together.
D. is converted into potential energy.
examples.target: B. increases and the particles move apart.

examples.input:
The relationship between ticks and a dog can best be described as
A. mutualism.
B. competition.
C. parasitism.
D. commensalism.

Small grasshoppers shed their outer covering as they grow larger. Which animal also sheds its outer covering as it grows larger?
A. frog
B. snake
C. fish
D. human

Two atoms of oxygen combine to form pure oxygen gas. What is the electrical charge of the O_{2} molecules?
A. positive
B. negative
C. neutral
D. variable

Which is not a type of electromagnetic wave?
A. sound wave
B. x-ray
C. microwave
D. radio wave

What is one way to help slow down or stop the greenhouse effect?
A. find new coal resources in the earth
B. clean up the litter in neighborhoods
C. clean up the water pollution in local lakes
D. walk or ride a bike instead of driving a car
examples.target: D. walk or ride a bike instead of driving a car

examples.input:
Great distances in space are measured in
A. kilometers.
B. light years.
C. megameters.
D. astronomical units.

Which of the following gives a plant cell its rigid structure?
A. cell membrane
B. nucleus
C. cell wall
D. chloroplast

Which alternative energy resource changes part of a river into a lake?
A. solar energy
B. geothermal energy
C. hydropower
D. biofuel energy

A student in a laboratory transfers a beaker containing a hot solution from the lab table to a cool water bath. Which of the following parts of the system experiences an increase in heat energy?
A. beaker
B. lab table
C. solution
D. water bath

Which example best illustrates kinetic energy?
A. a light bulb that is turned on
B. a car that is parked on top of a hill
C. a comet that is flying through space
D. a battery that is connected to a circuit
examples.target: C. a comet that is flying through space

examples.input:
Which theory about the origin of the universe states that a densely packed sphere exploded, forming clouds that condensed into galaxies?
A. the Galaxy theory
B. the Big Bang theory
C. the Steady State theory
D. the Oscillating theory

Which characteristic is shared by all members of Arthropoda and Chordata phyla?
A. mandibles
B. simple eyes
C. jointed limbs
D. one pair of wings

Which of the following is certain to change as a ball accelerates?
A. mass of the ball
B. inertia of the ball
C. velocity of the ball
D. force acting on the ball

One year a farmer decided not to plant crops in one of his fields. During that year his farm received a greater amount of precipitation than normal. Which will most likely occur in that unplanted field as a result of the greater precipitation?
A. more carbon dioxide will be trapped in the field
B. erosion of topsoil will increase in the field
C. invasive species will inhabit the field
D. animals will dig burrows in the field
examples.target: B. erosion of topsoil will increase in the field

examples.input:
Which group of energy sources are ALL renewable?
A. coal, oil, and natural gas
B. solar, oil, and geothermal
C. wind, solar, and tidal
D. natural gas, solar, and tidal

What happens to the molecules of a liquid when the liquid cools?
A. They slow down.
B. They speed up.
C. They decrease in number
D. They decrease in size

Some individuals are unable to digest the lactose found in the milk of cows. The digestive systems of these individuals most likely lack which?
A. a lipid that coats lactose molecules
B. an ability to produce lactose internally
C. an enzyme that catalyzes lactose breakdown
D. a tolerance to lactose developed during childhood
examples.target: C. an enzyme that catalyzes lactose breakdown

examples.input:
Use the information below to answer the question. The human body is composed of different systems made of specialized cells, tissues, and organs. Each of these structures has a specific function that aids in the survival of the human species. Which organs are used in reproduction?
A. brain, spinal cord, and eyes
B. lungs, esophagus, and heart
C. mouth, stomach, and gallbladder
D. ovaries, uterus, and fallopian tubes
examples.target: D. ovaries, uterus, and fallopian tubes

examples.input:
Which of the following best describes the relationship between frequency and wavelength of electromagnetic waves?
A. If the frequency remains constant, the wavelength increases.
B. The wavelength decreases as the frequency decreases.
C. The frequency increases as the wavelength decreases.
D. If the wavelength remains constant, the frequency increases.
examples.target: C. The frequency increases as the wavelength decreases.

examples.input:
Which pair would be most necessary for life to develop on another planet?
A. sulfur and nitrogen
B. helium and hydrogen
C. liquid water and carbon
D. chlorophyll and oxygen

How are light and sound similar?
A. They both travel at the same speed.
B. They are both waves.
C. They are both electromagnetic.
D. They both travel through a vacuum.

When heated, mercuric oxide decomposes to form liquid mercury and oxygen. A scientist heated 10 grams (g) of mercuric oxide and formed 9.3 grams of liquid mercury. How many grams of oxygen were formed?
A. 0.7 g
B. 9.3 g
C. 10.0 g
D. 19.3 g

When chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal, what type of substance is formed?
A. A mixture
B. A compound
C. An element
D. An alloy
E. A solution

A structure that carries a single unit of hereditary information is a
1. gene
2. tissue
3. sex cell
4. pedigree chart

Muscle cells need to quickly convert energy from food molecules into a usable form. For this reason, which of the following do muscle cells have in greater numbers than most other types of cells?
A. chromosomes
B. mitochondria
C. nuclei
D. vacuoles

Which would help conserve water?
A. Turn off water while brushing teeth
B. Wash the car every day
C. Water the lawn every day
D. Run the dishwasher after each meal
examples.target: A. Turn off water while brushing teeth

examples.input:
Which of these are both supplied to Earth by the Sun?
A. coal and oil
B. heat and light
C. friction and electricity
D. gravity and magnetism

A red flowered plant (RR) is crossed with a white flowered plant (WW) and produces plants with pink flowers (RW). If two pink flowered plants are crossed, what color offspring could be produced?
A. red, white, and pink
B. red and white
C. pink and red
D. pink and white

Which is the most accurate model to show how amino acids form proteins?
A. bees in a hive
B. cars on a train
C. petals on a flower
D. pieces in a jigsaw puzzle

What is the main function of the chloroplasts in plant cells?
A. to produce glucose
B. to keep the cell rigid
C. to make the cell divide
D. to allow the plant to reproduce

Gravity can be defined as a force of attraction between objects. The effects of gravity can be witnessed in many systems. Which of these actions is an example of gravity influencing other systems?
A. surface water evaporating into the atmosphere
B. planets moving around the Sun in an elliptical pattern
