D. groundwater moving to the surface in an artesian well
examples.target: B. planets moving around the Sun in an elliptical pattern

examples.input:
Which characteristic of a cold-water upwelling near the coast of Northern California results in a large concentration of marine organisms?
A. loss of thermal stability
B. high nutrient concentration
C. consistent surface-current flow rate
D. increased availability of dissolved oxygen

When mountains are formed, there is an interaction between areas of Earth. Which two will interact and result in the formation of mountains?
A. hydrosphere and biosphere
B. troposphere and ionosphere
C. hydrosphere and lithosphere
D. asthenosphere and lithosphere

A model of the Moon would be different from a model of Earth in that the Moon should
A. be smaller than Earth.
B. have a source of light inside.
C. have a smoother surface than Earth.
D. have fewer impact craters on the surface.

Which of the following correctly lists the structures in space from smallest to largest?
A. star, galaxy, solar system, universe
B. star, solar system, galaxy, universe
C. star, solar system, universe, galaxy
D. star, universe, solar system, galaxy
examples.target: B. star, solar system, galaxy, universe

examples.input:
Some changes are fast. Some changes are slow. Which of these changes is most likely the slowest?
A. fire
B. flood
C. landslide
D. drought

Which of these diseases is caused by a bacterium?
A. rabies
B. influenza
C. strep throat
D. chicken pox

When is the most energy transferred from the Sun to water in the water cycle?
A. during collection
B. during evaporation
C. during condensation
D. during precipitation

Which of the following shows the correct sequence of inventions?
A. printing press -> microscope -> telephone
B. television -> automobile -> microwave
C. airplane -> microphone -> radio
D. Doppler radar -> microphone -> telescope

When two animals live in the same area and depend on the same organism for food, they are
A. competing
B. decomposing
C. germinating
D. hibernating

Which statement describes a primary function of the cell wall of a plant cell?
A. The cell wall performs photosynthesis.
B. The cell wall stores DNA.
C. The cell wall provides structural support.
D. The cell wall manufactures proteins.
examples.target: C. The cell wall provides structural support.

examples.input:
Which metric units should be used to describe the mass of an object?
A. centimeters
B. liters
C. grams
D. degrees Celsius

Which form of energy is produced when a guitar string vibrates?
A. chemical
B. light
C. magnetic
D. sound

Andre learned that plants survive through a process called photosynthesis. Which substance do plants produce during photosynthesis?
A. minerals
B. nitrogen
C. soil
D. sugar

For years, scientists have classified plants according to their characteristics. Which most likely has led scientists to better identify and discover new species of plants?
A. construction of 3-D models
B. advances in the study of DNA
C. understanding the process of mitosis
D. development of the scientific method
examples.target: B. advances in the study of DNA

examples.input:
Which material best conducts heat and electricity?
A. metal
B. plastic
C. rubber
D. wood

Which two characteristics affect a planet's gravitational attraction to the Sun?
A. mass and volume
B. volume and length of day
C. distance from the Sun and mass
D. length of day and distance from the Sun
examples.target: C. distance from the Sun and mass

examples.input:
When a prairie ecosystem was disturbed, an invasive grass species outcompeted the native grass. The new grass had less nutritional value for the organisms living in the area. Which category of organism will be affected by this change first?
A. predators
B. herbivores
C. scavengers
D. decomposers

In the 1970s, the pesticide DDT was used to kill insects that damaged fruit and vegetable crops. Most insects died from being exposed to DDT, but some survived. These surviving insects contributed to an increase in their population by
A. migrating to habitats that had different types of crops.
B. learning how to avoid being exposed to DDT.
C. passing the gene for DDT resistance to their offspring.
D. competing with other types of insects for food.
examples.target: C. passing the gene for DDT resistance to their offspring.

examples.input:
Binary stars orbit around the center of mass of the two stars. What causes the stars to remain together?
A. gravity between the stars
B. energy released from the stars
C. nuclear reactions in the stars
D. magnetic attraction between the stars

After a star runs out of most of its hydrogen fuel, it becomes hotter and more luminous. What stage does this represent in the life cycle of a star?
A. quasar
B. protostar
C. red giant
D. white dwarf

How does no-till farming help the environment?
A. It decreases soil erosion.
B. It increases soil removal.
C. It increases fertilizer use.
D. It decreases crop yield.

In a laboratory, a sealed container with 100 g of steam is cooled until all the steam becomes a liquid. The container is then cooled further until all the water becomes a solid. Which of the following remains constant during both of these changes?
A. the mass of the water
B. the pressure in the container
C. the total energy of the water
D. the position of the atoms in the container
examples.target: A. the mass of the water

examples.input:
A student has decided to investigate whether the number of flowers on a plant will increase if the water supply to the plant is increased. She has five pots of geranium plants to use in her experiment. What factor in the experiment should be varied for the five plants in order to answer the student's question?
A. age of seedlings
B. temperature of water
C. volume of water
D. number of hours in sunlight

The energy that allows the water cycle to occur comes from
A. friction.
B. electricity.
C. the Sun.
D. radioactive decay.

Organisms that are classified as multicellular must have
A. only one cell.
B. large cells.
C. more than one cell.
D. identical cells.

Where does air go when a person breathes in?
A. Into the heart
B. Into the stomach
C. Into the lungs
D. Into the liver

Kudzu vines grow by climbing and wrapping around trees. Trees covered by kudzu can die because they are starved of sunlight. What type of relationship exists between the trees and the kudzu growing on them?
A. competition
B. mutualism
C. parasitism
D. predator-prey

In the United States, which is responsible for ensuring the safety of the country's drinking water?
A. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
B. Food and Drug Administration (FDA)
C. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
D. Center for Disease Control (CDC)

A student makes a fruit drink by stirring a powdered mix into cold water. Why is the fruit drink a solution?
A. The powder dissolves in the water.
B. The water changes color.
C. The student stirs the water.
D. The water is the proper temperature.
examples.target: A. The powder dissolves in the water.

examples.input:
Which life function is the same for an amoeba as for other freshwater protists?
A. the method used to obtain nutrients and energy
B. the process used to constantly remove excess water
C. the method used to detect changes in their environment
D. the process used to remove waste products from their cytoplasm
examples.target: B. the process used to constantly remove excess water

examples.input:
Proxima Centauri is the closest star to the Sun. Which units do astronomers most often use for the distance between Earth and Proxima Centauri?
A. miles
B. meters
C. light years
D. astronomical units

One positive effect of recycling aluminum cans to manufacture new beverage containers is
1. conserving Earth's resources
2. creating acid rain
3. warming Earth's atmosphere
4. increasing the ozone layer

Students are conducting an investigation to see how sunlight affects the speed of plant growth. They measure the growth of the plant at the end of two weeks. What would be the best way to communicate the results of this investigation?
A. draw a picture
B. make some notes
C. make a chart or graph
D. tell the science teacher
examples.target: C. make a chart or graph

examples.input:
The conservation of matter can be demonstrated by using chemical equations. Which chemical equation demonstrates the conservation of matter?
A. 2Sn + 4HNO_{3} -> SnO_{2} + 4NO_{2} + H_{2}O
B. I_{2} + 5Cl_{2} + 6H_{2}O -> 2HIO_{3} + 10HCl
C. Cl + 4Na -> 4NaCl
D. 4P + 5HNO_{3} -> 5NO + 3H_{3}PO_{4}

As the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere increases, which occurrence is most likely a long-term result?
A. The polar ice caps will melt.
B. Volcanoes will erupt more often.
C. The number of earthquakes will decrease.
D. Rainforests will be unable to support animal life.
examples.target: A. The polar ice caps will melt.

examples.input:
Which mineral, found in Arkansas, is an ore that can be used to produce aluminum?
A. quartz
B. galena
C. bauxite
D. diamond

A summer day begins with a clear, sunny sky. Then, dark clouds form in the afternoon. What type of weather will MOST likely happen next?
A. Sleet and snow
B. Rain and thunder
C. Wind and snow
D. Fog and wind

Eagles have strong, sharp beaks that are most likely adapted for the eagle to eat
A. fish.
B. eggs.
C. worms.
D. flowers.

When a spoon hits a table, it makes a loud sound. When the spoon hits a soft cushion, it does not make a sound. What is the difference between the table and the cushion that accounts for the sound?
A. The table is more reactive than the cushion.
B. The table vibrates more than the cushion.
C. The table is more insulated than the cushion.
D. The table has more potential energy than the cushion.
examples.target: B. The table vibrates more than the cushion.

examples.input:
When Dennis operates his lawnmower, he notices the engine makes a lot of noise. He also notices that the engine gets very hot. Which best describes the heat and noise generated from the lawnmower?
A. a change in phase
B. thermal expansion
C. an increase in entropy
D. mechanical advantage

What objects are affected by Earth's gravity?
A. only objects that have mass
B. only objects that sink in water
C. only objects that are made of metal
D. only objects that are heavier than air
examples.target: A. only objects that have mass

examples.input:
Abnormal cell division in humans may result in
1. cancer
2. fertilization
3. asexual reproduction
4. dynamic equilibrium

A donkey and a horse can be bred to produce a mule. Which observation is evidence that donkeys and horses are two different species?
A. They have different body sizes.
B. A mule is not able to reproduce.
C. They are found in different environments.
D. A mule does not resemble either parent.
examples.target: B. A mule is not able to reproduce.

examples.input:
What should students use to identify the percent chance of a trait being passed down from a parent to its offspring?
A. a graph
B. a flow chart
C. a data table
D. a Punnett square

Which rankings of trees would most likely useful in a scientific study of fruit production in apple trees?
A. date of flowering and the fruit yield
B. fruit yield and taste of the fruit
C. taste of the fruit and smell of the flower
D. date of flowering and smell of the flower
examples.target: A. date of flowering and the fruit yield

examples.input:
Which of the following characteristics is an acquired trait?
A. height
B. hair color
C. language
D. eye shape

Which stimulus causes a responding plant to demonstrate phototropism?
A. intensity of light
B. direction of light
C. length of day
D. time of day

Estuaries are marine environments located in areas where fresh water from rivers flow into the ocean. Estuaries are one of the most biologically productive ecosystems. Birds, fish, turtles and many other organisms inhabit these ecosystems. Which will most likely cause changes to estuary habitats on a global scale?
A. decreases in powerful hurricanes
B. decreases in volcanic eruptions
C. increases in earthquakes
D. increases in sea level

The trunk of a pine tree supports the tree. Which part of a daisy supports the plant the same way?
A. stem
B. flower
C. root
D. leaf

What property of electromagnetic waves makes it possible to use these waves to transmit information between a space shuttle and NASA mission control centers on the ground?
A. Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves.
B. Electromagnetic waves have very low velocity.
C. Electromagnetic waves are all visible to human eyes.
D. Electromagnetic waves can travel through a vacuum.
examples.target: D. Electromagnetic waves can travel through a vacuum.

examples.input:
A student is investigating solar energy by cooking food in an oven powered by the Sun. On which of the following days will the food cook most quickly?
A. a warm, rainy day
B. a warm, sunny day
C. a warm, cloudy day
D. a hot, cloudy day

Which is the correct order of the planets from the Sun?
A. Mercury, Venus, Earth, Saturn, Uranus, Jupiter, Mars, Neptune
B. Mercury, Earth, Mars, Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, Neptune, Uranus
C. Mercury, Venus, Mars, Earth, Jupiter, Uranus, Saturn, Neptune
D. Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune
examples.target: D. Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune

examples.input:
Which of these is the basic building block of complex organisms?
A. a cell
B. a tissue
C. an organ
D. an organ system

Which human response is most likely to occur because the air temperature is 90°F?
A. blinking
B. salivating
C. shivering
D. sweating

What are the properties of the Earth's crust and mantle that are most responsible for Earth's tectonic activity?
A. They are in different states and have different temperatures.
B. They are in the same state but have different temperatures.
C. They are in different states but have the same temperature.
D. They are the same state and have the same temperature.
examples.target: A. They are in different states and have different temperatures.

examples.input:
When a butterfly emerges from its chrysalis, its wings are crumpled. In order to expand its wings, the butterfly hangs upside down, causing fluid to be pumped into the veins of its wings. This pumping most likely expands the wings by
A. increasing the pressure inside the wings
B. decreasing the density of the wings
C. increasing the temperature inside the wings
D. decreasing the mass of the wings
examples.target: A. increasing the pressure inside the wings

examples.input:
Which of the following characteristics will best prevent a tree from being blown over by high winds during a storm?
A. deep roots
B. long branches
C. thick bark
D. wide leaves

Both prokaryotes and eukaryotes have small, free-floating organelles. The cell makes these organelles from nucleic acids and amino acids found in food. Without these organelles, the cell could not make proteins. What are these organelles called?
A. chloroplasts
B. mitochondria
C. ribosomes
D. vesicles

Which temperature is the freezing point of water?
A. 0°F
B. 32°F
C. 50°F
D. 100°F

Which statement best describes the molecules in a sample of water that was heated from a liquid to a gas?
A. The average size of the molecules decreased.
B. The average size of the molecules increased.
C. The average kinetic energy of the molecules decreased.
D. The average kinetic energy of the molecules increased.
examples.target: D. The average kinetic energy of the molecules increased.

examples.input:
Constellations are patterns of objects seen in the night sky from Earth. How are the objects in constellations like the Sun?
A. The objects are stars.
B. The objects are planets.
C. The objects are located in this solar system.
D. The objects heat the atmosphere of Earth.

Which is a trait a human most directly inherits from its parents?
A. eye color
B. musical taste
C. career choice
D. interest in reading

When observing a very small piece of dust in a liquid under a microscope, the dust appears to jiggle slightly. This movement results from the dust interacting with the molecules in the liquid. What property of the molecules in the liquid causes this effect?
A. The molecules briefly form chemical bonds with nearby objects.
B. The molecules are always in random motion.
C. The molecules transfer an electric charge to the dust particles.
D. The molecules frequently change shape.
examples.target: B. The molecules are always in random motion.

examples.input:
Which of the following happens in our solar system?
A. Earth revolves around the sun once per day.
B. The moon revolves around Earth once per day.
C. Earth revolves around the sun once per year.
D. The moon revolves around Earth once per year.
examples.target: C. Earth revolves around the sun once per year.

examples.input:
On a cold day, a student felt the tires of her bike before riding it to the store. When she arrived at the store, she felt the tires again and noticed that they were warmer. What caused the temperature of the bicycle tires to change?
A. the wind blowing against the tires
B. the air escaping from the spinning tires
C. the rubbing between the ground and the tires
D. the heat transferring from the rider's hands to the tire
examples.target: C. the rubbing between the ground and the tires

examples.input:
Chloroplasts in cells make it possible for the cells to
A. reproduce.
B. hold their rigid shape.
C. absorb and excrete materials.
D. carry out photosynthesis.

Which of these is the most important product of Virginia forests?
A. Pecan trees
B. Pine cones
C. Hardwood lumber
D. Maple leaves

Research in which of these areas has the greatest impact on the environment?
A. irradiating food
B. organic fertilizers
C. bacteria to clean up oil spills
D. developing larger, sweeter strawberries
examples.target: C. bacteria to clean up oil spills

examples.input:
The surface of Earth is covered mostly by
1. solid rock
2. molten rock
3. ice
4. water

Which pair of systems is responsible for the flow of blood in the human body?
A. circulatory and skeletal systems
B. skeletal and excretory systems
C. muscular and circulatory systems
D. respiratory and muscular systems

Where are the most reactive metals located on the periodic table?
A. the uppermost complete row of the table
B. the rows at the bottom of the table connecting two section
C. the column at the far left side of the table
D. the second column from the right side of the table
examples.target: C. the column at the far left side of the table

examples.input:
What major and potentially catastrophic events can be predicted to occur in the Northern Hemisphere between the months of June and November?
A. tsunamis
B. hurricanes
C. asteroid impacts
D. volcanic eruptions

The pull of gravity from Earth has the greatest effect on
A. comets.
B. the Sun.
C. asteroids.
D. the Moon.

What is the main advantage of making a laptop computer light in weight?
A. to make it easy to carry
B. to keep it simple to build
C. to make the screen easy to read
D. to provide storage for an electrical cord
examples.target: A. to make it easy to carry

examples.input:
It takes 365 days for
A. Earth to travel halfway around the Sun.
B. the Moon to travel halfway around Earth.
C. Earth to complete one orbit around the Sun.
D. the Moon to complete one orbit around Earth.
examples.target: C. Earth to complete one orbit around the Sun.

examples.input:
Some scientists once believed that Earth was solid like a marble. Which of these has been most responsible for changes in the scientific view of the structure of Earth?
A. discussions among earth scientists about new data
B. scientific books defining the layers of Earth
C. a lead scientist explaining the structure of Earth
D. a physical model of Earth showing its layers
examples.target: A. discussions among earth scientists about new data

examples.input:
A student wants to organize a group of animals into two categories based on observable external features. Which display will most appropriately show the two categories of animals?
A. a timeline
B. a pie chart
C. a data table
D. a line graph

Ribosomes present in a particular cell are smaller than those found in plants. In which taxonomic group or groups could the cell be classified?
A. fungi only
B. archaea only
C. bacteria or archaea
D. bacteria or fungi

What happens to the path of a light ray as it passes from air into water at an angle?
A. Its path widens.
B. Its path bends.
C. Its path becomes shorter.
D. Its path continues in a straight line.

Vibrations in the air caused by hitting a drum form
A. radiation.
B. light.
C. electricity.
D. sound.

As humans grow, their bodies change. Which of these statements explains how humans grow?
A. Cells form a cell wall.
B. Cells increase in size.
C. Cells undergo cell division.
D. Cells merge to become larger.

Which event below involves a constructive force?
A. earthquake
B. volcanic eruption
C. flood
D. wind storm

Which of the following are formed when two crustal plates collide with one another?
A. hot spots
B. rift valleys
C. mountain ranges
D. mid-ocean ridges

The nucleus contains DNA. Which statement best describes how DNA controls the working of the cell?
A. It codes for proteins.
B. It inhibits division of cells.
C. It helps in energy transformation.
D. It regulates traffic in and out of the cell.

Which of the following provides the best evidence that Earth has evolved over geologic time?
A. coral reefs that slowly changed size
B. desert sand dunes that were shaped by winds
C. deposits of sediment found at the mouth of a river
D. rock containing fossilized seashells found on a mountaintop
examples.target: D. rock containing fossilized seashells found on a mountaintop

examples.input:
The best explanation of why carnivores are dependent on plants is because they
A. need to consume plant matter.
B. use plants for shelter.
C. need carbon dioxide released by plants.
D. consume other animals that eat plants.
examples.target: D. consume other animals that eat plants.

examples.input:
In the late 1600s, Anton van Leeuwenhoek began making observations with simple magnifying lenses that he constructed. To which scientific field is Leeuwenhoek credited with the most contributions?
A. plant genetics
B. disease control
C. DNA sequencing
D. microbiology

Which section of Earth is composed primarily of liquid metal?
A. crust
B. mantle
C. outer core
D. inner core

One way humans store energy is by making the molecule glycogen. Clusters of which atoms are rearranged when the body digests plant sugars to make glycogen?
A. hydrogen, nitrogen, carbon
B. oxygen, sulfur, carbon
C. carbon, hydrogen, oxygen
D. nitrogen, carbon, sulfur

The number of stars in the Milky Way Galaxy is best estimated as
A. one hundred thousand.
B. one hundred million.
C. one hundred billion.
D. one hundred trillion.

Which type of substances serves as a catalyst for reactions that break large food molecules into smaller useful molecules?
A. enzymes
B. vitamins
C. lipids
D. nucleotides

What effect does gravity always have on an object on Earth?
A. makes the object move
B. makes the object stay still
C. pushes the object upward
D. pulls the object downward

Which is the best example of a chemical reaction?
A. blocked sunlight casts a shadow
B. sunlight evaporates water from a lake
C. oxygen absorbs sunlight forming ozone molecules
D. a prism refracts sunlight into light of different wavelengths
examples.target: C. oxygen absorbs sunlight forming ozone molecules

examples.input:
Some one-celled organisms can reproduce by the process of
1. hormone secretion
2. metamorphosis
3. fertilization
4. cell division

One important use of coal is to produce energy for homes. Coal can be burned and converted to
A. wind energy.
B. nuclear energy.
C. electrical energy.
D. solar energy.

Which of the following is NOT a mixture?
A. Air
B. Blood
C. Orange juice
D. Salt

What kind of energy do all moving objects have?
A. Light energy
B. Solar energy
C. Kinetic energy
D. Renewable energy

In a forest ecosystem, the squirrels eat seeds from trees. The squirrels are then eaten by hawks, owls, and foxes. If there were no more owls present in this ecosystem, which would most likely happen in the forest?
A. The squirrel population would increase.
B. The hawk population would decrease.
C. The fox population would decrease.
D. The tree population would increase.
examples.target: A. The squirrel population would increase.

examples.input:
Which of the following has the greatest direct influence on movement of the lithosphere?
A. the Sun
B. the Moon
C. Earth's core
D. Earth's mantle

When humans first began to grow crops, which of these most likely contributed to the extinction of native animal species?
A. pollution
B. climate change
C. habitat destruction
D. tectonic plate motion

Which of these does the MOST harm to the air?
A. Chopping down trees with an ax in the backyard
B. Collecting fall leaves
C. Cutting grass with a gas-powered lawnmower
D. Picking colorful wildflowers along the highway
examples.target: C. Cutting grass with a gas-powered lawnmower

examples.input:
A scanning electron microscope is best suited for observing
A. diffraction of light.
B. tectonic features on planets.
C. the surfaces of small objects.
D. topographical features on the ocean floor.
examples.target: C. the surfaces of small objects.

examples.input:
A bird eats a brightly-colored insect that tastes bad. The bird avoids preying on this type of insect again. This example is best described as
A. a physical characteristic.
B. a learned behavior.
C. an inherited behavior.
D. an adaptation.

In winter, the arctic fox has white fur. In summer, its fur changes color to brown and gray. The change in fur color helps the arctic fox to ___.
A. run
B. mate
C. hide
D. hibernate

In which ways are hills most different from mountains?
A. Hills are smaller and more rounded.
B. Hills are deeper and more level.
C. Hills are steeper and rockier.
D. Hills are taller and snowy.
examples.target: A. Hills are smaller and more rounded.

examples.input:
A bird builds a nest to
A. hibernate in winter
B. shelter its offspring
C. produce more feathers
D. eliminate waste

Which statement best describes the motion of the molecules of a solid object?
A. They vibrate in place within a fixed volume.
B. They move around freely within a fixed volume.
C. They vibrate in place and take the shape of a container.
D. They move around freely and take the shape of a container.
examples.target: A. They vibrate in place within a fixed volume.

examples.input:
What happens when salt water is boiled?
A. The water evaporates and the salt remains in the beaker.
B. Both the salt and the water evaporate and leave the beaker.
C. The salt becomes a new compound.
D. The salt will evaporate from the water and disperse into the environment.
examples.target: A. The water evaporates and the salt remains in the beaker.

examples.input:
Which set of elements has similar bonding properties?
A. Cl, Br, and F
B. K, Ca, and Sc
C. Kr, Cl, and O
D. Be, C, and O

Which body system processes foods into a useable source of energy?
A. circulatory
B. digestive
C. nervous
D. skeletal

What is the best way for a scientist to begin an investigation on a population of deer?
A. typing results into a computer
B. intuition
C. writing facts in a field notebook
D. observing the deer in their own habitat
examples.target: D. observing the deer in their own habitat

examples.input:
Which property of an object describes how easily electricity travels through it?
A. color
B. temperature
C. reflectivity
D. conductivity

Which is a statement of fact?
A. The Sun is very pretty.
B. The Sun is fun to study.
C. The Sun is larger than Earth.
D. The Sun is more interesting than the Moon.
examples.target: C. The Sun is larger than Earth.

examples.input:
Sydney is learning about the sources of energy that can run out. Which energy source will run out the fastest?
A. flowing water
B. natural gas
C. sunlight
D. wind

The first organisms to occupy an area after a prairie fire are known as
A. primary species.
B. secondary species.
C. succession species.
D. pioneer species.

Which of the following is caused by a virus?
A. ulcer
B. malaria
C. tuberculosis
D. influenza

When a beam of light passes through a clear, convex lens, the light will mostly
A. diffract and spread out.
B. diffract and come to a focal point.
C. refract and come to a focal point.
D. refract and spread out.
examples.target: C. refract and come to a focal point.

examples.input:
The symptoms of strep throat infection are a red and swollen throat. What is the most likely cause of strep throat?
A. eating raw vegetables
B. drinking lemonade
C. invading bacteria
D. running in cold weather

Compared to the particles in a hardened lava sample, the particles in a liquid lava sample
1. have a lower temperature
2. have less kinetic energy
3. are moving faster
4. are closer together

Which characteristic do both the Moon and Earth share?
A. They both have rocky surfaces.
B. They both have active volcanoes.
C. They both have similar atmospheres.
D. They both have the same gravitational pull.
examples.target: A. They both have rocky surfaces.

examples.input:
Which would be the most likely effect of a large decrease in the number of woodpeckers in a forest?
A. Temperatures would increase.
B. Precipitation would increase.
C. The number of trees in the forest would increase.
D. The insect population in the forest would increase.
examples.target: D. The insect population in the forest would increase.

examples.input:
Which two life processes occur in both plants and humans?
A. growing and reproducing
B. germinating and making food
C. growing and making food
D. germinating and reproducing

In order for Galileo to build a telescope, he needed to know about
A. lenses.
B. metals.
C. chemical mixtures.
D. the making of leather.

A birdwatcher wants to identify an eastern bluebird. What feature of a bird should the birdwatcher evaluate first to identify an eastern bluebird?
A. beak shape
B. eye position
C. feather pattern
D. tail-feather length

When a neutral atom gains or loses electrons, it becomes
A. more stable.
B. an isotope.
C. an ion.
D. less charged.

Which is an effect of regular exercise?
A. weaker bones
B. less energy
C. better hearing
D. stronger heart

A light year is used to measure
A. time.
B. distance.
C. luminosity.
D. temperature.

As an object falls, air resistance gradually increases until it is equal with the pull of gravity. This effect is called
A. final velocity.
B. initial velocity.
C. escape velocity.
D. terminal velocity.

All of these elements are metals except
A. gold.
B. helium.
C. sodium.
D. aluminum.

Observation and measurement are important to scientific investigations because
A. they are part of the instructions.
B. they are used to test a hypothesis.
C. they are required to make a hypothesis.
D. they keep you safe during an investigation.
examples.target: B. they are used to test a hypothesis.

examples.input:
When air rises over the open ocean, a low pressure system is formed. Which factor increases the potential of a low pressure system developing into a hurricane in the Northern Hemisphere?
A. cool ocean currents circulating towards the equator
B. increased volcanic activity in the upper latitudes
C. cold air moving south from the North Pole
D. warm water temperatures in the tropics
examples.target: D. warm water temperatures in the tropics

examples.input:
Imprints of the shells of ocean clams are often found in the rocks of the Appalachian Mountains. What do these imprint fossils most likely indicate?
A. These mountains were once under the ocean.
B. These mountains once had a more rainy climate.
C. Mountain river clams evolved from ocean clams.
D. Ocean clams evolved from mountain river clams.
examples.target: A. These mountains were once under the ocean.

examples.input:
A population of ground squirrels has established a community in the grasslands of the Great Plains. Temperatures often reach -15°C for most of the winter. What is the most likely behavior the ground squirrels use to survive these winter temperatures?
A. burrowing below the frost point of the soil surface
B. burrowing in tree trunks above the soil surface
C. consuming roots found under the soil surface
D. consuming organisms found in the soil surface
examples.target: A. burrowing below the frost point of the soil surface

examples.input:
Which is the lowest level of environmental organization that would include the water quality and air temperature in an area?
A. biome
B. ecosystem
C. community
D. population

When you bend your arm at the elbow, the bones and muscles in your arm are acting as a system. What simple machine does this system represent?
A. Inclined plane
B. Pulley
C. Wedge
D. Lever

A student places a pan of water on the stove. What happens to some of the water as it is heated to a boil?
A. It becomes a gas.
B. It becomes a solid.
C. It gets new atomic bonds.
D. It gets destroyed.

What are the parts that make up an atom?
A. electrons, neutrons, and protons
B. electrons, protons, and gamma rays
C. neutrons, photons, and beta particles
D. neutrons, protons, and alpha particles

One end of a metal rod is placed over a flame during an investigation. A thermometer is touching the opposite end of the metal rod. Which best describes what is happening during this investigation?
A. Convection carries heat to the thermometer.
B. Radiant energy warms the thermometer.
C. Mechanical energy from the flame carries heat to the thermometer.
D. Heat from the flame is conducted through the metal rod to the thermometer.
examples.target: D. Heat from the flame is conducted through the metal rod to the thermometer.

examples.input:
Mountains are most likely formed
A. when glaciers melt.
B. from earthquakes.
C. when land sinks.
D. along tectonic plates.

Read the information about Alice's science project then answer the question. Alice needed to design a science project. She decided that she wanted to focus her project on how an earthworm's behavior helps it survive. Alice wrote down four ideas about earthworm behavior that she wanted to test. Which idea can be tested experimentally?
A. Earthworms like the taste of dirt better than sand.
B. Earthworms are happier in black dirt than red dirt.
C. Earthworms exist to decompose decaying materials.
D. Earthworms will move away from direct light sources.
examples.target: D. Earthworms will move away from direct light sources.

examples.input:
What do the elements sulfur (S), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and bromine (Br) have in common?
A. They are noble (inert) gases.
B. They are nonmetals.
C. They have the same thermal conductivity.
D. They have the same number of protons.

Tissue plasminogen activator is a natural blood thinner. The coded sequence for the blood thinner is called PLAT , found on chromosome 8. It is used to treat people who have heart attacks and strokes. Tissue plasminogen activator can be made through genetic engineering. What is tissue plasminogen activator?
A. a gene
B. a protein
C. a platelet
D. a DNA molecule

Which of these groups contains only metric measurements?
A. inches, grams, ounces
B. inches, pounds, ounces
C. centimeters, grams, milliliters
D. centimeters, pounds, milliliters

Scientists use large optical telescopes to obtain information about the planets in the solar system. What wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation provide this information?
A. gamma radiation
B. infrared radiation
C. radio waves
D. visible light

Which scientist is credited for the development of the polio vaccine?
A. Jonas Salk
B. Neil Armstrong
C. Albert Einstein
D. Jacques Cousteau

When a volcano erupts, new lava is deposited on the slopes of the volcano. After the lava cools and hardens, which types of organisms will most likely be the first to live on the new material?
A. large reptiles and amphibians
B. small birds and mammals
C. mosses and lichens
D. bushes and vines

Ella waves good-bye from the bus. What body system pulls on bones to let Ella wave her arm?
A. muscular system
B. nervous system
C. digestive system
D. circulatory system

Coral reefs are found in shallow tropical ocean waters. A coral reef is a diverse ecosystem that is supported by the photosynthesis of marine plants and the algae that live within the tissues of the coral. Given this information, when would the waters in a coral reef likely have the highest dissolved oxygen concentration?
A. 7 a.m.
B. 2 p.m.
C. 9 p.m.
D. midnight

What keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun?
A. tides
B. gravity
C. electricity
D. magnetism

As seen from Earth, the appearance of the Moon changes throughout the month. What causes the appearance of the Moon to change?
A. Earth rotating on its axis
B. the Moon rotating on its axis
C. Earth revolving around the Sun
D. the Moon revolving around Earth
examples.target: D. the Moon revolving around Earth

examples.input:
In producing an automobile, which of the 27 following is the best use of a robot?
A. to perform repetitive tasks
B. to determine the trunk space
C. to demonstrate passenger comfort
D. to perform quality control inspections

The Theory of Plate Tectonics is based on
A. evidence of sea floor spreading.
B. topographic mapping of mountain ranges.
C. an analysis of soil at the plate boundaries.
D. volcanic activity along coastlines.
examples.target: A. evidence of sea floor spreading.

examples.input:
Which of the following must all plant and animal species do in order for each species to survive?
A. migrate
B. reproduce
C. make food
D. change color

Which activity illustrates the main function of the motor neuron complex?
A. transferring impulses to the appropriate muscle
B. receiving sensory impulses from the environment
C. delivering regular impulses to the autonomic system
D. processing impulses within the cerebral cortex
examples.target: A. transferring impulses to the appropriate muscle

examples.input:
Nutrients are recycled when materials decompose in an ecosystem. Which is the best example of the decomposition process where organic material is recycled in an ecosystem?
A. a hawk eating a mouse
B. worms tunneling through soil
C. bacteria feeding on dead plants
D. a plant using nitrogen to make proteins
examples.target: C. bacteria feeding on dead plants

examples.input:
What is one function of tree roots?
A. to absorb sunlight
B. to absorb water
C. to make seeds
D. to make food

Food contains stored chemical energy. Which units of measurement can be used to compare the amounts of energy in different foods?
A. calories
B. decibels
C. newtons
D. watts

The freezing and expanding of water in the cracks of rocks is a form of
A. weathering.
B. deposition.
C. faulting.
D. erosion.

Which of the following is a way that everyone can help with conservation efforts?
A. camp in the woods
B. use biodegradable materials
C. visit a landfill
D. use disposable plates

Historically, how has the compass been used?
A. for navigation
B. to predict weather
C. to measure temperature
D. for mineral identification

A cut to the skin is treated with antiseptic first to avoid
A. an immune response.
B. a bacterial infection.
C. bruising of tissues.
D. an allergic reaction.

Which would be a safe practice to exercise during laboratory investigations?
A. using open flames to heat all materials
B. keeping your cell phone on the laboratory countertop
C. knowing where your instructor/laboratory leader is at all times
D. removing your safety glasses when moving from station to station
examples.target: C. knowing where your instructor/laboratory leader is at all times

examples.input:
The shape of the moon appears to change regularly during each month. Which of the following best explains why the shape of the moon appears to change?
A. The Earth turns on its axis.
B. The Moon turns on its axis.
C. The Moon orbits around the Earth.
D. Clouds cover the Moon.
examples.target: C. The Moon orbits around the Earth.

examples.input:
How do the nutrients necessary for plant growth get into the soil?
A. The soil absorbs sunlight.
B. Water filters through the soil.
C. Organic matter is decayed in the soil.
D. The soil is exposed to air.
examples.target: C. Organic matter is decayed in the soil.

examples.input:
Which part of a sunflower plant absorbs water and nutrients?
A. Roots
B. Stems
C. Leaves
D. Flowers
